title: Jarred Ezra Randall
text:
I am a Miami-born, Philadelphia-based professional with a recent Master’s degree in Urban Spatial Analytics (MUSA) from the University of Pennsylvania, focusing on Affordable Housing & Policy. With a strong foundation in data analysis, project management, and cross-functional team leadership, I bring diverse professional experience as a Technical Project Manager, Geospatial Analyst, and Landscape Designer.
Throughout my career, I have consistently demonstrated the ability to manage projects effectively, deliver insightful analyses, and excel in team-oriented environments with a focus on clear communication, time management, and a strong work ethic. My passion lies in leveraging data and technology to deliver impactful solutions, with a strong emphasis on collaboration, process optimization, and operational efficiency.
I possess a robust skill set that includes project management, advanced data analysis, and technical proficiency in R, Python, and GIS. I am committed to using these skills to drive successful project execution, improve business processes, and deliver results that align with strategic goals.



Led Cross-Functional Projects and Teams: Managed multiple complex projects from initiation through delivery, ensuring successful and timely execution by leading teams and coordinating across departments.
Data-Driven Project Planning: Utilized data analysis and spatial modeling to provide actionable insights for effective project planning, ensuring projects align with client goals and regulatory standards.
Stakeholder and Client Collaboration: Facilitated clear and consistent communication with stakeholders, ensuring alignment on project scope, progress, and outcomes. Adjusted project approaches based on stakeholder feedback and data-driven insights.
Technical Leadership in Finance and Operations Projects: Worked as part of multidisciplinary teams to implement and improve systems, ensuring compliance, data accuracy, and operational efficiency.
Process Improvement and Compliance: Developed comprehensive project documentation, frameworks, and governance processes to ensure regulatory compliance and support effective decision-making.
Produced high-quality graphic exhibits, renderings, and data visualizations: Communicated design concepts and analytical insights effectively to clients and stakeholders, using data visualization tools to translate complex statistical data into actionable insights.
Conducted survey fieldwork and data collection: Gathered essential data for project planning and spatial analysis, contributing to informed and accurate design decisions.





Technical Project Management: Effective in leading projects from conception to completion with a focus on data-driven decision-making.
Creative Thinking and Problem Solving:: Adept at generating innovative solutions and tackling complex challenges in both design and analysis.
Advanced Data Analysis, Modeling, and Visualization: Proficient in using R, Python, and GIS for spatial analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization to inform decision-making.
Stakeholder Engagement and Leadership: Skilled in building relationships across functions to facilitate collaboration, ensure stakeholder alignment, and drive successful project outcomes.
Analytical Problem Solving: Strong ability to identify challenges, generate innovative solutions, and drive projects toward successful outcomes.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Thrive in collaborative environments, effectively managing communication between teams, stakeholders, and clients.




In my free time, I’m a musician and still an avid cook who loves to cook over an open fire. I have played in musical projects based in Gainesville, FL & Jamaica Plain, MA, including Kvetch, Tiny Farm, and Camp Hope. I enjoy going on hikes with my dog Ripley and am a big sports fan, especially of Miami teams like the Heat, Panthers, and Dolphins.



Meet Ripley!

title: Resume
text: It appears you don’t have a PDF plugin for this browser. No biggie… you can click here to download the PDF file.

title: A Planning Support Tool for Affordable and Workforce Housing Site Identification
text:
For an independent study in applications of remote sensing for sustainable urban planning, I used Google Earth Engine and global wetlands datasets to train a Random Forest model on Landsat 7 spectral images and assess wetlands change from 2000 to 2020.
My model achieved 95% accuracy and 65% recall, and suggests that the Iberá wetlands have declined significantly in the past 20 years.
library(htmltools)
includeHTML("Projects/Practicum/Watauga-housing.html")
